trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication FAQ

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-factor authentication is a method of verifying who you are that requires the use of more than just a username and password. It provides an additional layer of security to user sign-ins and transactions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-factor authentication is a method of verifying who you are that requires the use of more than just a username and password. It provides an additional layer of security to user sign-ins and transactions.

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication FAQ

trans-unit.source: This FAQ answers questions about Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ answers questions about Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model and usability.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model and usability.

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: Q: How can I get help with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?
trans-unit.target: Q: How can I get help with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Search the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Search the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Search the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB) for technical solutions to common break-fix issues about Support for Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor).
trans-unit.target: Search the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB) for technical solutions to common break-fix issues about Support for Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor).

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Active Directory Forums</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Active Directory Forums</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: You can search and browse for technical questions and answers from the community or ask your own question by clicking <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can search and browse for technical questions and answers from the community or ask your own question by clicking <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Password reset</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Password reset</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Legacy Phonefactor customers who have any queries around resetting your password or for help to get your password reset, please use the link below to open a support case.
trans-unit.target: Legacy Phonefactor customers who have any queries around resetting your password or for help to get your password reset, please use the link below to open a support case.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor) customer support</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor) customer support</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Use this link to contact a Microsoft support professional.
trans-unit.target: Use this link to contact a Microsoft support professional.

trans-unit.source: We’ll ask you a few questions to help us determine what your support options are.
trans-unit.target: We’ll ask you a few questions to help us determine what your support options are.

trans-unit.source: The support options may include email, on-line submission or phone support.
trans-unit.target: The support options may include email, on-line submission or phone support.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>General inquiries about Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>General inquiries about Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor) or if you have questions around how to buy the product and different support options available, please either visit or email <link><linkText>pfsales@microsoft.com</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server (Phone Factor) or if you have questions around how to buy the product and different support options available, please either visit or email <link><linkText>pfsales@microsoft.com</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Q: How does the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server handle user data?
trans-unit.target: Q: How does the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server handle user data?

trans-unit.source: When you use the Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) Server on-premises, a user’s data is stored in the on-premises servers.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) Server on-premises, a user’s data is stored in the on-premises servers.

trans-unit.source: No persistent user data is stored in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: No persistent user data is stored in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: When the user performs a two-factor authentication, the MFA Server sends data to the Azure MFA cloud service to perform the authentication.
trans-unit.target: When the user performs a two-factor authentication, the MFA Server sends data to the Azure MFA cloud service to perform the authentication.

trans-unit.source: When these authentication requests are sent to the cloud service, the following fields are sent in the request and logs so that they are available in the customer's authentication/usage reports.
trans-unit.target: When these authentication requests are sent to the cloud service, the following fields are sent in the request and logs so that they are available in the customer's authentication/usage reports.

trans-unit.source: Some of the fields are optional so they can be enabled or disabled within the Multi-Factor Authentication Server.
trans-unit.target: Some of the fields are optional so they can be enabled or disabled within the Multi-Factor Authentication Server.

trans-unit.source: The communication from the MFA Server to the MFA cloud service uses SSL/TLS over port 443 outbound.
trans-unit.target: The communication from the MFA Server to the MFA cloud service uses SSL/TLS over port 443 outbound.

trans-unit.source: These fields are:
trans-unit.target: These fields are:

trans-unit.source: Unique ID - either username or internal MFA server ID
trans-unit.target: Unique ID - either username or internal MFA server ID

trans-unit.source: First and Last Name - optional
trans-unit.target: First and Last Name - optional

trans-unit.source: Email Address - optional
trans-unit.target: Email Address - optional

trans-unit.source: Phone Number - when doing a voice call or SMS authentication
trans-unit.target: Phone Number - when doing a voice call or SMS authentication

trans-unit.source: Device token - when doing mobile app authentication
trans-unit.target: Device token - when doing mobile app authentication

trans-unit.source: Authentication Mode
trans-unit.target: Authentication Mode

trans-unit.source: Authentication Result
trans-unit.target: Authentication Result

trans-unit.source: MFA Server Name
trans-unit.target: MFA Server Name

trans-unit.source: MFA Server IP
trans-unit.target: MFA Server IP

trans-unit.source: Client IP – if available
trans-unit.target: Client IP – if available

trans-unit.source: In addition to the fields above, the authentication result (success/denial) and reason for any denials is also stored with the authentication data and available through the authentication/usage reports.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the fields above, the authentication result (success/denial) and reason for any denials is also stored with the authentication data and available through the authentication/usage reports.

trans-unit.source: Billing
trans-unit.target: Billing

trans-unit.source: Q: Will my organization be charged for phone calls or text messages used to authenticate my users?
trans-unit.target: Q: Will my organization be charged for phone calls or text messages used to authenticate my users?

trans-unit.source: All costs are rolled into the per-user or per-authentication cost of the service.
trans-unit.target: All costs are rolled into the per-user or per-authentication cost of the service.

trans-unit.source: Organizations are not charged for individual phone calls placed or text messages sent to your end users when using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Organizations are not charged for individual phone calls placed or text messages sent to your end users when using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Phone owners may incur roaming-related or other costs from their telephone carriers to receive the phone calls or text messages.
trans-unit.target: Phone owners may incur roaming-related or other costs from their telephone carriers to receive the phone calls or text messages.

trans-unit.source: "Q: How is the organization billed for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?"
trans-unit.target: "Q: How is the organization billed for Azure Multi-Factor Authentication?"

trans-unit.source: The ‘per user’ or ‘per authentication’ billing/usage model is chosen when creating a Multi-Factor Auth Provider in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The ‘per user’ or ‘per authentication’ billing/usage model is chosen when creating a Multi-Factor Auth Provider in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: It is a consumption-based resource that is billed against the organization’s Azure subscription, just like virtual machines, websites, etc. are billed against the subscription.
trans-unit.target: It is a consumption-based resource that is billed against the organization’s Azure subscription, just like virtual machines, websites, etc. are billed against the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Q: Does the ‘per user’ billing model charge based on the number of users enabled for Multi-Factor Authentication or the number of users who perform the verifications?
trans-unit.target: Q: Does the ‘per user’ billing model charge based on the number of users enabled for Multi-Factor Authentication or the number of users who perform the verifications?

trans-unit.source: Billing is based on the number of users enabled for Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Billing is based on the number of users enabled for Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Usability
trans-unit.target: Usability

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do if I don’t receive a response on my phone or if I forgot my phone?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do if I don’t receive a response on my phone or if I forgot my phone?

trans-unit.source: If you previously configured a backup phone, try again by selecting that phone when prompted from the sign in page.
trans-unit.target: If you previously configured a backup phone, try again by selecting that phone when prompted from the sign in page.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have another method configured, contact your admin and ask them to update the number assigned to your primary phone – mobile or office.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have another method configured, contact your admin and ask them to update the number assigned to your primary phone – mobile or office.

trans-unit.source: Q: I removed a user from an admin role but forgot to disable the multi-factor authentication and now it’s not showing in the list how do I remove this feature?
trans-unit.target: Q: I removed a user from an admin role but forgot to disable the multi-factor authentication and now it’s not showing in the list how do I remove this feature?

trans-unit.source: Depending on which portal you are using, in the left pane, click either Users or Users and Groups.
trans-unit.target: Depending on which portal you are using, in the left pane, click either Users or Users and Groups.

trans-unit.source: Select the check box next to the user that you want to edit, and then click either Edit or the Edit icon.
trans-unit.target: Select the check box next to the user that you want to edit, and then click either Edit or the Edit icon.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings, under Assign role, select Yes, and add the user back to the previous admin role.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings, under Assign role, select Yes, and add the user back to the previous admin role.

trans-unit.source: Go to the multi-factor authentication page.
trans-unit.target: Go to the multi-factor authentication page.

trans-unit.source: The account should now be showing up in the list on the page.
trans-unit.target: The account should now be showing up in the list on the page.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps above to disable multi-factor authentication for an account.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps above to disable multi-factor authentication for an account.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you can now remove the account from the admin role.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you can now remove the account from the admin role.

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do if a user contacts me, the administrator, with an account that has been locked out?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do if a user contacts me, the administrator, with an account that has been locked out?

trans-unit.source: You can reset the user by forcing them to go through the registration process again.
trans-unit.target: You can reset the user by forcing them to go through the registration process again.

trans-unit.source: To do this see <link><linkText>Managing user and device settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To do this see <link><linkText>Managing user and device settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do if a user has lost or had a device stolen that is using app passwords?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do if a user has lost or had a device stolen that is using app passwords?

trans-unit.source: You can delete all of the users app passwords to prevent any unauthorized access.
trans-unit.target: You can delete all of the users app passwords to prevent any unauthorized access.

trans-unit.source: Once you have a replacement device, the user can recreate them.
trans-unit.target: Once you have a replacement device, the user can recreate them.

trans-unit.source: To do this see <link><linkText>Managing user and device settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To do this see <link><linkText>Managing user and device settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Q: What if the user is not able to sign into non-browser apps?
trans-unit.target: Q: What if the user is not able to sign into non-browser apps?

trans-unit.source: Users enabled for multi-factor authentication will require app password to sign into some non-browser apps.
trans-unit.target: Users enabled for multi-factor authentication will require app password to sign into some non-browser apps.

trans-unit.source: Users will need to clear the sign-in info (delete sign-in info), restart the application and sign-in with the their username and app password.
trans-unit.target: Users will need to clear the sign-in info (delete sign-in info), restart the application and sign-in with the their username and app password.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating app passwords see <link><linkText>Help with app passwords</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For information on creating app passwords see <link><linkText>Help with app passwords</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Modern Authentication for the Office 2013 Clients
trans-unit.target: Modern Authentication for the Office 2013 Clients

trans-unit.source: Office 2013 clients (including Outlook) now support new Authentication Protocols and can be enabled to support Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Office 2013 clients (including Outlook) now support new Authentication Protocols and can be enabled to support Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: This means that once enabled, app passwords are not required for use with Office 2013 clients.
trans-unit.target: This means that once enabled, app passwords are not required for use with Office 2013 clients.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link><linkText>Office 2013 modern authentication public preview announced</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link><linkText>Office 2013 modern authentication public preview announced</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do if I do not receive a text message, or I reply to a two-way text message but the verification times out?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do if I do not receive a text message, or I reply to a two-way text message but the verification times out?

trans-unit.source: The Azure Multi-Factor Authentication service sends text messages through SMS aggregators.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Multi-Factor Authentication service sends text messages through SMS aggregators.

trans-unit.source: Many factors may impact the reliability of text message delivery and receipt including the aggregator used, destination country, mobile phone carrier and signal strength.
trans-unit.target: Many factors may impact the reliability of text message delivery and receipt including the aggregator used, destination country, mobile phone carrier and signal strength.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, delivery of text messages and receipt of SMS replies when performing two-way SMS is not guaranteed.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, delivery of text messages and receipt of SMS replies when performing two-way SMS is not guaranteed.

trans-unit.source: Using one-way SMS is recommended over two-way SMS when possible because it is more reliable and prevents users from incurring global SMS charges caused by replying to a text message that was sent from another country.
trans-unit.target: Using one-way SMS is recommended over two-way SMS when possible because it is more reliable and prevents users from incurring global SMS charges caused by replying to a text message that was sent from another country.

trans-unit.source: Text message verifications are also more reliable in some countries such as the United States and Canada.
trans-unit.target: Text message verifications are also more reliable in some countries such as the United States and Canada.

trans-unit.source: Users that experience difficulty receiving text messages reliably when using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication are encouraged to select the mobile app or phone call methods instead.
trans-unit.target: Users that experience difficulty receiving text messages reliably when using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication are encouraged to select the mobile app or phone call methods instead.

trans-unit.source: The mobile app is great because mobile app notifications can be received over both cellular and Wi-Fi connections, and the mobile app passcode is displayed even when the device has no signal at all.
trans-unit.target: The mobile app is great because mobile app notifications can be received over both cellular and Wi-Fi connections, and the mobile app passcode is displayed even when the device has no signal at all.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Authenticator app is available for <link><linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Android</linkText><title></title></link>, and <link><linkText>IOS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Authenticator app is available for <link><linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Android</linkText><title></title></link>, and <link><linkText>IOS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Errors
trans-unit.target: Errors

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do when I see an “Authentication request is not for an activated account” error when I authenticate by using mobile application notifications?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do when I see an “Authentication request is not for an activated account” error when I authenticate by using mobile application notifications?

trans-unit.source: Go to <link><linkText>https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/profile/</linkText><title></title></link> and sign in with your organizational account.
trans-unit.target: Go to <link><linkText>https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/profile/</linkText><title></title></link> and sign in with your organizational account.

trans-unit.source: If needed, click Other verification options and select a different option for completing the account verification.
trans-unit.target: If needed, click Other verification options and select a different option for completing the account verification.

trans-unit.source: Click Additional Security Verification.
trans-unit.target: Click Additional Security Verification.

trans-unit.source: Remove the existing account from your mobile application.
trans-unit.target: Remove the existing account from your mobile application.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure and follow the instructions to re-configure the mobile application.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure and follow the instructions to re-configure the mobile application.

trans-unit.source: Q: What do I do when I see a 0x800434D4L error while attempting to sign-in using a non-browser application?
trans-unit.target: Q: What do I do when I see a 0x800434D4L error while attempting to sign-in using a non-browser application?

trans-unit.source: Currently, additional security verification can only be used with applications/services that you can access through your browser.
trans-unit.target: Currently, additional security verification can only be used with applications/services that you can access through your browser.

trans-unit.source: Non-browser applications (also referred to as rich client applications) which are installed on your local computer such as Windows Powershell will not work with accounts that are required for additional security verification.
trans-unit.target: Non-browser applications (also referred to as rich client applications) which are installed on your local computer such as Windows Powershell will not work with accounts that are required for additional security verification.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you may see the application generate error 0x800434D4L.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you may see the application generate error 0x800434D4L.

trans-unit.source: A workaround for this is to have a separate user account for admin-related operations vs. non-admin operations.
trans-unit.target: A workaround for this is to have a separate user account for admin-related operations vs. non-admin operations.

trans-unit.source: You can later link mailboxes between your admin account and non-admin account so you can sign-in to outlook using your non-admin account.
trans-unit.target: You can later link mailboxes between your admin account and non-admin account so you can sign-in to outlook using your non-admin account.

trans-unit.source: For more details about this, see <link><linkText>Give an Administrator the Ability to Open and View the Contents of a User's Mailbox</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about this, see <link><linkText>Give an Administrator the Ability to Open and View the Contents of a User's Mailbox</linkText><title></title></link>.
